website_summaries.verdict: This book has nice illustrations and includes spiders and other "bugs" with more than 6 legs.
pros: Provides interesting information for both adults and children
A nice general guide that comes to a good size considering the number of insects it features
A good book for easy reference
cons: The book is a great reference, but doesn't include as many common names as it could

customer_reviews.title: DIfficult to use
customer_reviews.text: It's sometimes hard to find the insect I'm looking for. For instance, I was looking for assassin bug and it's not in the index or pictorial table of contents. It was under zelus longipes or typical true bugs. Didn't know that it was in either of those categories. I wish there were more common names in the index.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent field ID guide
customer_reviews.text: I like this guide more than others. Unless you want a specific order guide (for Coleoptera, Diptera, etc) this is a great general guide. It lists many species with colored photos and gives nice lengthy descriptions for most of them. I prefer this over the Audubon Society insect guide, which in my opinion has less description and species but offers ranges and size specifics. It also has a nice little section for other invertebrates which are not insects. For its amount of descriptive information and photos, it is a great size. I can fit it into my satchel along with my specimen jars and gear when I go on a trek. 5/5 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Y

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This guide includes an impressive list of North American insects, but does a poor job of describing differences, and has an appalling lack of morphological sex differences. The photos are often small so do a poor in helping identification of closely related species with subtle differences. The descriptions are extremely brief and unhelpful. You are better off purchasing the different guides for insect groups.
customer_reviews.author: Nordic

customer_reviews.title: Great! Insects shown as would be seen in the field and a good explanations
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful guide for the field and I was so relieved when I found it. The insects appear posed as you would see them in the field rather than other (usually older) field guides based on pinned specimens. It is a great sized and well organized with avoiding unnecessary/excessive information that other field guides do (which turns them into more of a daunting encyclopedia than a field guide). The species featured are also good representatives of their taxon. This guide is honest about advice on getting from family-level to genera and species and indicates the number of species within a general to help users understand how large and diverse some taxon are.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: This book was a bit of a disappointment as I was hoping it had maps of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This book was a bit of a disappointment as I was hoping it had maps of the range of a certain insect. It allows you to identify an insect but says little about it's habits, food preferences. A lot of the data is grouped by family and only the scale of the pictures allows good identifications of closely resembled family members. It's better than nothing but just barely.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mammano

customer_reviews.title: Our family loves this book
customer_reviews.text: We used to borrow this book from the library every time we’d camp, but one time someone else had checked it out and we were bummed so we decided to buy the book. It’s a great one that has most of the insects we find. Of course it can’t have all of them and still be as compact as this one. We like the sturdiness of the cover of this paperback.
customer_reviews.author: Chiefspecial

customer_reviews.title: Great content...but bound backwards!
customer_reviews.text: The content of the book is good, as expected for this line of guides. Coverage of species is a little sparse in many families, but this is a guide for enthusiastic beginners. However, the copy shipped to me was bound backwards! The guide is useable this way but the color-coded tabs are bound in rather than facing out, which makes them of little use. The formatting of the photos is also off because of the binding mistake. I ordered a used guide, and it is in near-mint condition. I did not expect it to also be irregular! Amusing, but time will tell how distracting the irregular binding is.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Reference
customer_reviews.text: It has a great variety of all types of insects, but more obscure ones are very limited in species like silverfish or springtails. For common species of common insects it'll do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great book with lots of information
customer_reviews.text: Very complete book for the curious about insects. It doesn't claim to have all the information that scientists would need, but it contains enough to satisfy an average person's interest.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great general book for bugs and beetles but do not buy this for Butterfly and Moth ID's.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of butterflies or moths so make sure you get a separate book for those. But just ID about 15 different weevils , and 7 beetles, and That's not a Bee its a fly ... Who knew? So ya having lots of fun. Taking photos and IDing them later.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent holiday gift to stimulate a person's interest in insects.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful colored pictures to stimulate a person's interest in collecting insects! And the accompanying text tells us whether an insect is good or bad, so that we know whether we should kill it and add it physically to our collection, or to just "capture" it with our camera and put it into our photo album. This information is useful even to someone who is already into collecting insects.
customer_reviews.author: JohnJ

customer_reviews.title: So many bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is almost perfect as the book is slightly hard to navigate and understand, I with is was set up better
customer_reviews.author: Teal

customer_reviews.title: good work
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this guide over the National Audubon Society Field Guide to Insects and Spiders. I have them both (1980 copyright of Audubon) but if I could have only one, it would be Kaufman since in many instances it has more pictures of specific groups than does Audubon. Syphidae: Kaufamn, 40 vs Audubon, 6. Carabidae: Kaufman, 33 vs Audubon, 6. Coccinellidae: Kaufman, 43 vs Audubon 5. Moths and caterpillars as a group, Kaufman, nearly 300 vs Audubon, nearly 150. I suggest you compare the two books at a bookstore to see which fits your needs. Be sure to compare the INDEX of both books. I have not seen the newest edition of Audubon.
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Lilly

customer_reviews.title: So many bugs, so little time
customer_reviews.text: A well organized, very comprehensive book. No info on spiders, because technically they are not insects, but arachnids.
customer_reviews.author: Fredstench

customer_reviews.title: Stunned!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing world of just the bugs God has created. A super book on them.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G French

customer_reviews.title: Another hit for Kenn Kaufman
customer_reviews.text: Kenn Kaufman and his team have put out another easy to use and beautiful to look at field guide. Unlike many insect field guides out there, the reader does not need any scientific knowledge to use this effectively. It has color-coded pages for the sections, and section sub-headings like "If it's really small or really weird looking, try here". Of course, no insect guide weighing less than a small car can include all the insects of North America, but this one has an impressive number of insects, useful photos of every one, and good information on them.
customer_reviews.author: Welsh Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Explains a lot
customer_reviews.text: Nicely explains why those HUGE taxonomy books from the library rarely got me down to species. Great text and images.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS DEY

customer_reviews.title: It's filled with so much information and great photo's!
customer_reviews.text: Ready for a gift for my family. It came quickly and well packaged. Within just a couple of days of ordering. Can't wait to see his smile when he gets this field guide. It's filled with so much information and great photo's!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Insect Guide to North America.
customer_reviews.text: Detailed illustrations. Accurate information. Includes many common and less common insects. Of all insect field guides I've used, this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanjae

customer_reviews.title: Kaufmann Guide covers a lot of ground
customer_reviews.text: The Kaufmann Field Guide to Insects covers an impossible amount of subject matter, and does it well. It will certainly get you close enough to an ID to follow through on the Net, Google it, and find out more. The photos are clear enough, and the examples diverse enough to make it very usable when you're in the field, and find something you weren't looking for in the first place. A purchase I have enjoyed, and one I would do again. Certainly a good present for anyone living in rural areas, and most suburban locations.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Another great Kaufman field guide! We also have and love their Butterfly Guide and Insect Guide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bug book out there. It has great picture and detailed information. I bought for my daughter when she was four so we could read it together and study critters. She is 7 now and we still use it on a somewhat daily basis. My sister saw it and asked for one for Christmas stating "this has to be the best bug book I've seen," I'm a big fan pf all Kaufman books now.
customer_reviews.author: SewMarci

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: All four field guides were Christmas gifts to 5 year old granddaughters. They enjoy going on nature hikes and identifying what they observe.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra2002

customer_reviews.title: Best insect guide to date
customer_reviews.text: This is the best field guide available for the novice or experienced entomologist. The diversity of insects shown are beautifully illustrated and their identifications are accurate. The guide is very user-friendly with different easy ways to access insects by groups, common names, and scientific names. The descriptions, although brief, are very informative and highlight pertinent aspects of the insect groups or individual species being discussed. The authors are to be commended for producing the very first insect guide that enables an individual unfamiliar with entomology to rapidly get at least a good idea of the kind of insect he or she is trying to identify, and with so many common insects illustrated, a specific identification is possible in many cases.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. Krinsky

customer_reviews.title: Thourough reference
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old grandson is an insect freak. Every year I get him an age appropriate reference book. This is the best one so far!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good insect field guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good insect field guide. I bought it not just only for an entomology class but for personal help and knowledge of good and bad insects.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: A great companion for the amateur entomologist
customer_reviews.text: This guide is fantastic and easy to use. My son is very much into entomology right now and this guide has helped us identify virtually all of the bugs we have collected this summer effortlessly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice pics and organization
customer_reviews.text: The reason this doesn't get a five star is because some of the pictures and names didn't quite match what we were learning in class which was frustrating and confusing when trying to label an insect collection. But, for the most part, the pictures were very helpful and the organization in this book is great.
customer_reviews.author: SBTTruth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd favorite insect field guide! Great to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Hanush Sisters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the beginner and the serious bugwatcher
customer_reviews.text: The Kaufman Field Guide to Insects of North America packs a tremendous amount of useful information into a book small enough to carry. It is an informative introduction and guide to every major group of insects you're likely to encounter on this continent north of Mexico. The book's organization is logical; the writing is accurate, clear, and concise; and the nearly 2,500 color photos of representative species are sharp and striking. Almost as soon as I received my copy, it became the first book I go to when I see an insect I can't identify.
customer_reviews.author: Don Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Book
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for a 5 year old and he loves it. great illustrations and detail.
customer_reviews.author: mtngirl

customer_reviews.title: Good quick reference guide
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful in identifying bugs we find in our yard. Good quick reference guide.
customer_reviews.author: Randy and Kelly of Coeur d'Alene

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. It made a great gift for my son. Very well laid out book. Very user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book for the amateur insect identifier
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book for the amateur insect identifier. It's sometimes difficult to find the insect and then there isn't always a good description of it :(
customer_reviews.author: emikkuma

customer_reviews.title: Love Bugs??
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this book to donate to one of our schools in our area. The children every year have to do an insect project. The books they have at school can't be taken home and have the classifications in them. So they borrow this book from our library on a regular basis. I bought one for their library so they would have an extra!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Feltes

customer_reviews.title: well organized
customer_reviews.text: I like how the book is organized. It makes it easier to find groups of similar insects and narrow down your search. Of course there are so many insects out there that they can't all fit in one field guide, but it forms a good starting point for identifying an insect. The pictures are very good and so are the descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: birdologist

customer_reviews.title: Great book for kids interested in bugs!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. My 7 yr old son was always asking what a certain bug was that he had found in our yard or other places so I saw this book and decided to buy it. It contains a ton of bugs that can be found right in our yard and he loves the book. He carries it around everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: THEURN8OR

customer_reviews.title: One of the essential field guide into the world of insects
customer_reviews.text: Colorful photographs and concise explanation of each insect covered in the book. I recommended this book for beginner entomology student, professional in the field or a person interested in nature.
customer_reviews.author: Vthemaestro

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: Since receiving this book, I've been identifying every little bug that scampers across my path. The cover is rugged, well suited for a backpack. Great photos and descriptions, perfect for an armchair entomologist like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Buying_Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Insects in Color
customer_reviews.text: The guide is useful in the identification of insects. The photos are great. It has outstanding sections on bees and moths.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Very nice picture guide, great and extremely quick for entomology students takes a bit longer but still quickly find what you want if you do not know much if anything about insects for a quick "close" enough ID
customer_reviews.author: Jikopia

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful field guide as are all of Kenn Kaufman's books
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful field guide as are all of Kenn Kaufman's books. It doesn't have every insect in it, but what book ever could? This is perfect for my needs. Thank you Kenn!
customer_reviews.author: L. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Awesome effort. Good overview of the species types and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome effort. Good overview of the species types and varieties. Too many bugs still left to get into one book. This is recommended for the avid gardener and nature lover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Junk! The book is upside and backwards! Pages falling out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my primary reference for "name that bug" questions.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: The One to Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you need one "bug book" this is the gold standard for the layman.
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

customer_reviews.title: this is a great quick reference book with most of the common insects ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great quick reference book with most of the common insects that you would see out in the field or your backyard. Love the photos and all of the helpful and interesting information.
customer_reviews.author: buffalobeal

customer_reviews.title: Bugs-UGH
customer_reviews.text: this is quite a comprehensive guide I use it to identify insects that I didn't have where I used to live previously.
customer_reviews.author: WindyWu

customer_reviews.title: Learn about bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Love this book amazing reference guide fantastic images of hundreds of species well organized and informative
customer_reviews.author: Carson Decker

customer_reviews.title: I haven't found a better field guide.
customer_reviews.text: This insect field guide is amazing. I'm able to ID the vast majority of insects collected in the field to species.
customer_reviews.author: C. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Totally Bugged Out
customer_reviews.text: This book includes lots of good pictures and basic despcriptions of bugs-it has made it very easy to identify many bugs I have encountered. I would like more fun facts and details to be included, but overall, this is a great guide for adults and children alike to learn to identify bugs!
customer_reviews.author: Butters

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: We use this book almost daily from spring to late autumn. Very excellently written, detailed and perfect photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product is very useful in the field
customer_reviews.text: Great product is very useful in the field . Fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: cwl

customer_reviews.title: he loved it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 14 yr old nephew. He couldn't put it down. He is really into bugs and identifying what he finds around his house.
customer_reviews.author: M.Halsted

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent visual guide for bugs! It takes a lot of guesswork out of identifying different insects. I'm happy to add it to my arsenal of field guides!
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband and grand kids use it a lot to check out bugs.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca huff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this guide. It is such an amazing resource. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: Nico0157

customer_reviews.title: another general insect book
customer_reviews.text: The book is an excellent complement to the Peterson insect book. The range of insects pictured is wide. This does not teach about insect biology and the information for each species is very little. The species you run across in everyday life are here, or close relatives are here. Once you know a name you can start to find out more!
customer_reviews.author: carol coulter

customer_reviews.title: Good gift idea.
customer_reviews.text: Good book for adults and curious children. Well made, nice pictures.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Good reference
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of hiking and wondered what some of the insects were so I got this guide. The first insect I looked up was not listed so that was frustrating and it is abundant on our hikes. But it is a good starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Bantz

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide to Insects of NA
customer_reviews.text: This excellent field guide was very reasonably priced; the order arrived in perfect condition when promised.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Score Buff

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's the easiest to use Bug Guide I've found yet. Illustrations are all in color which is a huge help.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: Great book.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift to my father. He really enjoys it. Very useful and informative. Great for those who are fans of the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: J. McCullough

customer_reviews.title: some what helpful
customer_reviews.text: it was more like what I was looking for but still not that easy for me to use lots of good picture to help Identify
customer_reviews.author: JACK

customer_reviews.title: Another great Kaufman guide
customer_reviews.text: Fascinating. Excellent job! Eaton and Kaufman, like the great E. O. Wilson, are telling us the story of our planet's ecosystems by describing the animal kingdom of the small. This is what real education looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: ... the Kaufman guides to technical for a lay person like myself.
customer_reviews.text: I find all the Kaufman guides to technical for a lay person like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Great Book for a compact guide!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cant beat it! Im not an expert, but have been studing insects for 10 years, and I love the simplicity of this guide! I also own the butterfly guide and really like that one as well! I wish there was a Sibley for everthing, but theres not, so this is next best! Looking forward to Kaufmans next guide!
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: A comprehensive look at insect life/identification one is likely to encounter close at hand. Relates to being a useful guide for family. John Holms
customer_reviews.author: John Holms

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide
customer_reviews.text: Though this is not the only book you will need, when trying to learn about and identify the insects around us, it is certainly a very helpful one. One of the best insect ID books I have ever seen, I just wish that there was a bit more information about the insects presented.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Cecelic

customer_reviews.title: Great information
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful information on all kinds of insects. The pictures are great and filled with all kind of interesting descriptions of many insects.
customer_reviews.author: evelyn

customer_reviews.title: ALL IN ONE!
customer_reviews.text: excellent compact guide. Does a once over lightly approach which stays portable. Indications of individual ranges would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Keller

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman's Guide to insects of North America
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for just identifying most insects, but no real information on "what" they are.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Get it! Still have to thumb through to find what i'm looking for though!
customer_reviews.author: John Ellis

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect guide book for bugs
customer_reviews.text: The perfect guide book to take out to my garden and do ID on the good guys and bad guys. It is small enough to carry around so that ID's can be made easily.
customer_reviews.author: Gardengal

customer_reviews.title: coming from an entomologist
customer_reviews.text: I teach insect biology and ecology and this is by far my favorite easy-to-use field guide - I would strongly recommend it to anyone with an interest in identifying bugs.
customer_reviews.author: emilie gray

customer_reviews.title: Great Insect ID Book
customer_reviews.text: The Kaufman Guide is a wonderful resource for insect identification. The reproductions are good, the content accurate, the physicality of the book itself is nice to hold and flip through. Eric Eaton really knows his stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ZenMartha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for the non-expert
customer_reviews.text: I used the library copy of Kaufamn's book a lot last summer and decided to buy it for this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Vose Irish

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures/Illustrations. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Extremely helpful for Layman and Professional Field Entomologist. Great pictures/Illustrations. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: Great field guide, with thousands of excellent illustrations and useful descriptions, while still keeping the size of the volume portable! It is perfect to use in field trips for my Invertebrate Zoology class. It is useful in identifying the species, or at least the genus, and serves as a springboard to look for additional information online or in other sources.
customer_reviews.author: F. Moretzsohn

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 9 year old son!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this. Keeps it handy when he is bug hunting outside. Great pictures to refrence as well!
customer_reviews.author: heather miller

customer_reviews.title: An easy guide
customer_reviews.text: This book is very easy for identification of insects yet. I am a biology majoy, and I have never found anything easier. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Salce

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book!
customer_reviews.text: This is my bible. Thank you so much! Amazing book!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good introduction to the insects of North America, it helped me to id bugs for my insect collection
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Sanz

customer_reviews.title: Best general guide for insects
customer_reviews.text: I am one of a group of naturalists. We bought the books for our field trips and for teaching children.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice insect guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice guide to insects. It is easy to thumb through to find information and identification, even if you are not an entomologist.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jarsma

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide to Insects of North America
customer_reviews.text: The best field guide to the common insects of North America available. An excellent selection of taxa has been chosen as representatives. Anyone interested in insects needs this book.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Kondratieff

customer_reviews.title: Great, Informative Book
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Easy to find what you are looking for. I like every Kenn Kaufman guide I own. I've had a copy for several years, and I bought this one for a friend. Yes, you can search for a bug online, but there is just something about a book...
customer_reviews.author: cWj

customer_reviews.title: kids love it, lots of
customer_reviews.text: Gave me the crawlers, kids love it, lots of informaion
customer_reviews.author: vi
